contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox person | name = Pamela Sue Martin | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1953|01|05}} | birth_place = [[Hartford, Connecticut]], [[United States]] | death_date = <!-- {{Death date and age|YYYY|MM|DD|YYYY|MM|DD}} Death date then birth --> | death_place = | other_names = | nationality = [[United States|American]] | occupation = [[Actress]] <br /> [[Author]] <br />[[Model (profession)]] | years_active = 1970-present | spouse = Jorge Brusch ''(1979-1980)''<br>Manuel Rojas ''(1982-1984)''<br>Bruce Allen ''(1990-1998)'' | partner = | website = http://www.pamelasuemartin.com/ }} '''Pamela Sue Martin''' (born January 5, 1953) is an American actress best known for playing [[Nancy Drew]] on ''[[The Hardy Boys/Nancy Drew Mysteries]]'' TV series<ref>{{Amg name|46019}}</ref> and [[Fallon Carrington Colby]] on the [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] nighttime [[soap opera]] ''[[Dynasty (TV series)|Dynasty]]''. ==Biography== Born in [[Hartford, Connecticut]], and growing up in nearby Westport, Martin began modeling at 17, and appeared in the original film version of ''[[The Poseidon Adventure (1972 film)|The Poseidon Adventure]]'' (opposite [[Gene Hackman]]) at the age of 19. During the run of ''Nancy Drew'' she appeared in a cover-featured pictorial in the July 1978 issue of ''[[Playboy]]'' magazine. Martin portrayed feisty and spoiled heiress [[Fallon Carrington Colby]] on the [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] nighttime [[soap opera]] ''[[Dynasty (TV series)|Dynasty]]'' from its debut in 1981 through the end of the fourth season in 1984. Martin left of her own accord and the character was "missing and presumed dead" — the series recast the role with actress [[Emma Samms]] at the end of the fifth season in 1985. She hosted ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' on February 16, 1985. In 1984, Martin, who has long been involved in environmental causes, appeared in a public service announcement to help save [[pink dolphin]]s in the [[Amazon River]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.7thvoyageprod.com/ |title=Pamela Sue Martin: PSA Help Save Pink Dolphins |work=7th Voyage Productions |accessdate=2008-11-01}}</ref> The ad was directed by Clyde Lucas, who appeared on ''The Hardy Boys/Nancy Drew Mysteries.'' Divorced three times and the mother of one son, Martin has written about her struggle with [[interstitial cystitis]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.tmz.com/2008/10/24/pamela-sue-martin/ |title=Pamela Sue Martin |work=TMZ |date=2008-10-24}} </ref> Martin owns a theatre company in Idaho. == Television == * ''[[The Girls of Huntington House]]'' ({{ytv|1973}}) * ''The Gun and the Pulpit'' ({{ytv|1974}}) * ''[[The Hardy Boys/Nancy Drew Mysteries]]'' ({{ytv|1977}}–{{ytv|1978}}) * ''Human Feelings'' (1978) * ''[[Dynasty (TV series)|Dynasty]]'' ({{ytv|1981}}–{{ytv|1984}}) * ''Strong Medicine'' ({{ytv|1986}}) * ''Bay Coven'' ({{ytv|1987}}) * ''The Saint: The Software Murders'' ({{ytv|1989}}) * ''Sky Trackers'' ({{ytv|1990}}) * ''That '70s Show'' ({{ytv|2002}}) * ''The L Word'' ({{ytv|2006}}) ''(uncredited)'' == Filmography == * ''[[To Find a Man]]'' (1972) * ''[[The Poseidon Adventure (1972 film)|The Poseidon Adventure]]'' (1972) * ''[[Buster and Billie]]'' (1974) * ''Our Time'' (1974) * ''[[The Lady in Red (1979 film)|The Lady in Red]]'' (1979) * ''Torchlight'' (1984) * ''Flicks'' (1987) * ''[[A Cry in the Wild]]'' (1990) * ''McTaggart's Fortune'' (2010) * ''Soupernatural'' (2010) (post-production) ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.pamelasuemartin.com/ Pamela Sue Martin Official site] *{{IMDb name|id=0552863|name=Pamela Sue Martin}} *{{Amg name|46019}} *{{TV Guide name|pamela-sue-martin/168832/Pamela Sue Martin}} *{{rotten-tomatoes-person|pamela_sue_martin}} {{Authority control|VIAF=223774569}} {{Persondata |NAME= Martin, Pamela Sue |ALTERNATIVE NAMES= |SHORT DESCRIPTION=actress |DATE OF BIRTH= January 5, 1953 |PLACE OF BIRTH= [[Westport, Connecticut]], U.S. |DATE OF DEATH= |PLACE OF DEATH= }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Martin, Pamela Sue}} [[Category:American film actresses]] [[Category:American television actresses]] [[Category:People from Westport, Connecticut]] [[Category:1953 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Actresses from Connecticut]]
